prior_knowledge_digest: Students are expected to have a basic understanding of language learning concepts, such as vocabulary, grammar, and syntax from their native language studies. Familiarity with the concept of root words and derivatives will be beneficial as they begin to explore Latin. Additionally, students should be comfortable with classroom routines and basic study skills, such as note-taking and active listening.
misconception_watchlist: Assuming Latin word order is the same as English

primary: Introduce students to the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Establish classroom routines for Latin learning

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask any initial questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone and encourage curiosity.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and basic pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice sounds.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio recordings to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings in pairs.
lesson_flow.student_action: Engage in simple dialogues using greetings.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the importance of Latin in historical and modern contexts.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in discussion and share thoughts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the relevance of Latin in various fields.

lesson_flow.description: Recap the day's learning and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on what was learned and ask questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to practice pronunciation at home.
